intro: Centaurea nigra var. pallida, commonly known as pale centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, pale blue to whitish flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance. The species is often found in open woodland, grasslands, and disturbed soils, showing adaptability to a range of environmental conditions.
